setAdmin

public void setAdmin(org.openspaces.admin.Admin admin)
Description copied from interface: ProvisioningDriver
Passes an Admin API object that can be used to query the current cluster state. The Admin API is typically only required for advanced use cases, like BYON. IMPORTANT: do not perform any blocking operations on this Admin instance as it is running in single threaded mode. Trying to use waitFor() methods on this instance will wither block forever or fail with a timeout.

Specified by:
setAdmin in interface ProvisioningDriver
Parameters:
admin - an instance of the Admin API, running in single threaded mode.

addListener

public void addListener(ProvisioningDriverListener pdl)
Description copied from interface: ProvisioningDriver
Adds a new listener. It is the responsibility of the cloud driver developer to publish a list of supported events.

Specified by:
addListener in interface ProvisioningDriver
Parameters:
pdl - A class that implements ProvisioningDriverListner.

setConfig

public void setConfig(Cloud cloud,
                      String cloudTemplateName,
                      boolean management)
Description copied from interface: ProvisioningDriver
Called once on startup of the cloud driver, passing the cloud configuration to it.

Specified by:
setConfig in interface ProvisioningDriver
Parameters:
cloud - The cloud configuration for this driver
cloudTemplateName - The template required for this cloud driver.
management - true if this driver will launch management machines, false otherwise.

handleServerCredentials

protected void handleServerCredentials(MachineDetails machineDetails)
                                throws CloudProvisioningException
Handles credentials for accessing the server - in this order: 1. Password or key file set for this specific server 2. Key file set for the entire cloud 3. Password set for the entire cloud

Parameters:
machineDetails - The MachineDetails object that represents this server
Throws:
CloudProvisioningException - Indicates missing credentials or IOException (when a key file is used)

publishEvent

protected void publishEvent(String eventName,
                            Object... args)
Publish a provisioning event occurred for the listeners registered on this class.

Parameters:
eventName - The name of the event (must be in the message bundle)
args - Arguments that complement the event message
